titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Paul Garris, Indictment
CWG10841

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Nelson Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Ky
against } Indictment
Paul Garris_

The Grand Jury of Nelson County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Paul Garris of the offence of Grand Larceny Committed as follows: The said Paul Garris on the 1st Day of May 1861 in the County aforesaid did felloniously take steal and carry away two dresses a quantity of Jewelry and other female apparel the property of John Dawson of the value of more than four Dollars -- against the Peace and the dignity of the Commonwealth of Ky --

Witnesses before the Jury --
Julius Hays
G S Mock
Jno Dawson Sr
E Fard, F. Foyle
Dawson

A. Copy attest
Wm H Slaughter
Clk N C C

The Deft not appearing tho called it is Ordered that the bail bond be and is hereby declared forfeited and that summons issue thereon.
And it is Ordered that an alias bench warrant issue endorsed that he be admitted to give bail in the sum of Three Hundred Dollars for his appearance --

And again in Court March 25th 1862 The process herein having been duly executed and the Defendant not appearing -- It is Ordered and alledged by the Court that the Plff recover of the Defr Jos Henin the Sum on Four Hundred Dollars the amount of the bail bond forfeited herein and the costs hereof for which Execution may issue. --

A Copy attest
Wm H Slaughter
C N C C
